00029  * Author: di.wang <di.wang@intel.com>

00032 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_CLASS
00033 
00034 #include <llog_swab.h>
00035 #include <lustre_obdo.h>
00036 #include <lustre_swab.h>

00041 
00042 static void out_reconstruct(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *dt,
00043                             struct dt_object *obj,
00044                             struct object_update_reply *reply,
00045                             int index)
00046 {
00047         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: fork reply reply %p index %d: rc = %d\n",
00048                dt_obd_name(dt), reply, index, 0);
00049 
00050         object_update_result_insert(reply, NULL, 0, index, 0);
00051         return;
00052 }
00053 
00054 typedef void (*out_reconstruct_t)(const struct lu_env *env,
00055                                   struct dt_device *dt,
00056                                   struct dt_object *obj,
00057                                   struct object_update_reply *reply,
00058                                   int index);
00059 
00060 static inline int out_check_resent(const struct lu_env *env,
00061                                    struct dt_device *dt,
00062                                    struct dt_object *obj,
00063                                    struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00064                                    out_reconstruct_t reconstruct,
00065                                    struct object_update_reply *reply,
00066                                    int index)
00067 {
00068         if (likely(!(lustre_msg_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_RESENT)))
00069                 return 0;
00070 
00071         if (req_xid_is_last(req)) {
00072                 struct lsd_client_data *lcd;
00073 
00074                 /* XXX this does not support mulitple transactions yet, i.e.
00075                  * only 1 update RPC each time betwee MDTs */
00076                 lcd = req->rq_export->exp_target_data.ted_lcd;
00077 
00078                 req->rq_transno = lcd->lcd_last_transno;
00079                 req->rq_status = lcd->lcd_last_result;
00080                 if (req->rq_status != 0)
00081                         req->rq_transno = 0;
00082                 lustre_msg_set_transno(req->rq_repmsg, req->rq_transno);
00083                 lustre_msg_set_status(req->rq_repmsg, req->rq_status);
00084 
00085                 DEBUG_REQ(D_RPCTRACE, req, "restoring transno "LPD64"status %d",
00086                           req->rq_transno, req->rq_status);
00087 
00088                 reconstruct(env, dt, obj, reply, index);
00089                 return 1;
00090         }
00091         DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, req, "no reply for RESENT req (have "LPD64")",
00092                  req->rq_export->exp_target_data.ted_lcd->lcd_last_xid);
00093         return 0;
00094 }
00095 
00096 static int out_create(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00097 {
00098         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00099         struct object_update    *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00100         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00101         struct dt_object_format *dof = &tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_dof;
00102         struct obdo             *lobdo = &tti->tti_u.update.tti_obdo;
00103         struct lu_attr          *attr = &tti->tti_attr;
00104         struct lu_fid           *fid = NULL;
00105         struct obdo             *wobdo;
00106         size_t                  size;
00107         int                     rc;
00108 
00109         ENTRY;
00110 
00111         wobdo = object_update_param_get(update, 0, &size);
00112         if (IS_ERR(wobdo) || size != sizeof(*wobdo)) {
00113                 CERROR("%s: obdo is NULL, invalid RPC: rc = %ld\n",
00114                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(wobdo));
00115                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(wobdo));
00116         }
00117 
00118         if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(tsi->tsi_pill->rc_req))
00119                 lustre_swab_obdo(wobdo);
00120         lustre_get_wire_obdo(NULL, lobdo, wobdo);
00121         la_from_obdo(attr, lobdo, lobdo->o_valid);
00122 
00123         dof->dof_type = dt_mode_to_dft(attr->la_mode);
00124         if (update->ou_params_count > 1) {
00125                 fid = object_update_param_get(update, 1, &size);
00126                 if (IS_ERR(fid) || size != sizeof(*fid)) {
00127                         CERROR("%s: invalid fid: rc = %ld\n",
00128                                tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(fid));
00129                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(fid));
00130                 }
00131                 if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(tsi->tsi_pill->rc_req))
00132                         lustre_swab_lu_fid(fid);
00133                 if (!fid_is_sane(fid)) {
00134                         CERROR("%s: invalid fid "DFID": rc = %d\n",
00135                                tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PFID(fid), -EPROTO);
00136                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00137                 }
00138         }
00139 
00140         if (lu_object_exists(&obj->do_lu))
00141                 RETURN(-EEXIST);
00142 
00143         rc = out_tx_create(tsi->tsi_env, obj, attr, fid, dof,
00144                            &tti->tti_tea, tti->tti_tea.ta_handle,
00145                            tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00146                            tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index);
00147 
00148         RETURN(rc);
00149 }
00150 
00151 static int out_attr_set(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00152 {
00153         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00154         struct object_update    *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00155         struct lu_attr          *attr = &tti->tti_attr;
00156         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00157         struct obdo             *lobdo = &tti->tti_u.update.tti_obdo;
00158         struct obdo             *wobdo;
00159         size_t                   size;
00160         int                      rc;
00161 
00162         ENTRY;
00163 
00164         wobdo = object_update_param_get(update, 0, &size);
00165         if (IS_ERR(wobdo) || size != sizeof(*wobdo)) {
00166                 CERROR("%s: empty obdo in the update: rc = %ld\n",
00167                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(wobdo));
00168                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(wobdo));
00169         }
00170 
00171         attr->la_valid = 0;
00172         attr->la_valid = 0;
00173 
00174         if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(tsi->tsi_pill->rc_req))
00175                 lustre_swab_obdo(wobdo);
00176         lustre_get_wire_obdo(NULL, lobdo, wobdo);
00177         la_from_obdo(attr, lobdo, lobdo->o_valid);
00178 
00179         rc = out_tx_attr_set(tsi->tsi_env, obj, attr, &tti->tti_tea,
00180                              tti->tti_tea.ta_handle,
00181                              tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00182                              tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index);
00183 
00184         RETURN(rc);
00185 }
00186 
00187 static int out_attr_get(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00188 {
00189         const struct lu_env     *env = tsi->tsi_env;
00190         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(env);
00191         struct object_update    *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00192         struct obdo             *obdo = &tti->tti_u.update.tti_obdo;
00193         struct lu_attr          *la = &tti->tti_attr;
00194         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00195         int                     idx = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index;
00196         int                     rc;
00197 
00198         ENTRY;
00199 
00200         if (unlikely(update->ou_result_size < sizeof(*obdo)))
00201                 return -EPROTO;
00202 
00203         if (!lu_object_exists(&obj->do_lu)) {
00204                 /* Usually, this will be called when the master MDT try
00205                  * to init a remote object(see osp_object_init), so if
00206                  * the object does not exist on slave, we need set BANSHEE flag,
00207                  * so the object can be removed from the cache immediately */
00208                 set_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE,
00209                         &obj->do_lu.lo_header->loh_flags);
00210                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00211         }
00212 
00213         dt_read_lock(env, obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00214         rc = dt_attr_get(env, obj, la);
00215         if (rc)
00216                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
00217 
00218         obdo->o_valid = 0;
00219         obdo_from_la(obdo, la, la->la_valid);
00220         lustre_set_wire_obdo(NULL, obdo, obdo);
00221 
00222 out_unlock:
00223         dt_read_unlock(env, obj);
00224 
00225         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: insert attr get reply %p index %d: rc = %d\n",
00226                tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00227                0, rc);
00228 
00229         object_update_result_insert(tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply, obdo,
00230                                     sizeof(*obdo), idx, rc);
00231 
00232         RETURN(rc);
00233 }
00234 
00235 static int out_xattr_get(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00236 {
00237         const struct lu_env        *env = tsi->tsi_env;
00238         struct tgt_thread_info     *tti = tgt_th_info(env);
00239         struct object_update       *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00240         struct lu_buf              *lbuf = &tti->tti_buf;
00241         struct object_update_reply *reply = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply;
00242         struct dt_object           *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00243         char                       *name;
00244         struct object_update_result *update_result;
00245         int                     idx = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index;
00246         int                        rc;
00247 
00248         ENTRY;
00249 
00250         if (!lu_object_exists(&obj->do_lu)) {
00251                 set_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE,
00252                         &obj->do_lu.lo_header->loh_flags);
00253                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00254         }
00255 
00256         name = object_update_param_get(update, 0, NULL);
00257         if (IS_ERR(name)) {
00258                 CERROR("%s: empty name for xattr get: rc = %ld\n",
00259                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(name));
00260                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(name));
00261         }
00262 
00263         update_result = object_update_result_get(reply, 0, NULL);
00264         if (update_result == NULL) {
00265                 CERROR("%s: empty name for xattr get: rc = %d\n",
00266                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), -EPROTO);
00267                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00268         }
00269 
00270         lbuf->lb_len = (int)tti->tti_u.update.tti_update->ou_result_size;
00271         lbuf->lb_buf = update_result->our_data;
00272         if (lbuf->lb_len == 0)
00273                 lbuf->lb_buf = 0;
00274         dt_read_lock(env, obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00275         rc = dt_xattr_get(env, obj, lbuf, name);
00276         dt_read_unlock(env, obj);
00277         if (rc < 0)
00278                 lbuf->lb_len = 0;
00279         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: "DFID" get xattr %s len %d\n",
00280                tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PFID(lu_object_fid(&obj->do_lu)),
00281                name, (int)lbuf->lb_len);
00282 
00283         GOTO(out, rc);
00284 
00285 out:
00286         object_update_result_insert(reply, lbuf->lb_buf, lbuf->lb_len, idx, rc);
00287         RETURN(0);
00288 }
00289 
00290 static int out_index_lookup(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00291 {
00292         const struct lu_env     *env = tsi->tsi_env;
00293         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(env);
00294         struct object_update    *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00295         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00296         char                    *name;
00297         int                      rc;
00298 
00299         ENTRY;
00300 
00301         if (unlikely(update->ou_result_size < sizeof(tti->tti_fid1)))
00302                 return -EPROTO;
00303 
00304         if (!lu_object_exists(&obj->do_lu))
00305                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00306 
00307         name = object_update_param_get(update, 0, NULL);
00308         if (IS_ERR(name)) {
00309                 CERROR("%s: empty name for lookup: rc = %ld\n",
00310                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(name));
00311                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(name));
00312         }
00313 
00314         dt_read_lock(env, obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00315         if (!dt_try_as_dir(env, obj))
00316                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc = -ENOTDIR);
00317 
00318         rc = dt_lookup(env, obj, (struct dt_rec *)&tti->tti_fid1,
00319                        (struct dt_key *)name);
00320 
00321         if (rc < 0)
00322                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
00323 
00324         if (rc == 0)
00325                 rc += 1;
00326 
00327 out_unlock:
00328         dt_read_unlock(env, obj);
00329 
00330         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "lookup "DFID" %s get "DFID" rc %d\n",
00331                PFID(lu_object_fid(&obj->do_lu)), name,
00332                PFID(&tti->tti_fid1), rc);
00333 
00334         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: insert lookup reply %p index %d: rc = %d\n",
00335                tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00336                0, rc);
00337 
00338         object_update_result_insert(tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00339                             &tti->tti_fid1, sizeof(tti->tti_fid1),
00340                             tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index, rc);
00341         RETURN(rc);
00342 }
00343 
00344 static int out_xattr_set(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00345 {
00346         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00347         struct object_update    *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00348         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00349         struct lu_buf           *lbuf = &tti->tti_buf;
00350         char                    *name;
00351         char                    *buf;
00352         __u32                   *tmp;
00353         size_t                   buf_len = 0;
00354         int                      flag;
00355         size_t                   size = 0;
00356         int                      rc;
00357         ENTRY;
00358 
00359         name = object_update_param_get(update, 0, NULL);
00360         if (IS_ERR(name)) {
00361                 CERROR("%s: empty name for xattr set: rc = %ld\n",
00362                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(name));
00363                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(name));
00364         }
00365 
00366         /* If buffer == NULL (-ENODATA), then it might mean delete xattr */
00367         buf = object_update_param_get(update, 1, &buf_len);
00368         if (IS_ERR(buf) && PTR_ERR(buf) != -ENODATA)
00369                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(buf));
00370 
00371         lbuf->lb_buf = buf;
00372         lbuf->lb_len = buf_len;
00373 
00374         tmp = object_update_param_get(update, 2, &size);
00375         if (IS_ERR(tmp) || size != sizeof(*tmp)) {
00376                 CERROR("%s: emptry or wrong size %zu flag: rc = %ld\n",
00377                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), size, PTR_ERR(tmp));
00378                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(tmp));
00379         }
00380 
00381         if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(tsi->tsi_pill->rc_req))
00382                 __swab32s(tmp);
00383         flag = *tmp;
00384 
00385         rc = out_tx_xattr_set(tsi->tsi_env, obj, lbuf, name, flag,
00386                               &tti->tti_tea, tti->tti_tea.ta_handle,
00387                               tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00388                               tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index);
00389         RETURN(rc);
00390 }
00391 
00392 static int out_xattr_del(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00393 {
00394         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00395         struct object_update    *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00396         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00397         char                    *name;
00398         int                      rc;
00399         ENTRY;
00400 
00401         name = object_update_param_get(update, 0, NULL);
00402         if (IS_ERR(name)) {
00403                 CERROR("%s: empty name for xattr set: rc = %ld\n",
00404                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(name));
00405                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(name));
00406         }
00407 
00408         rc = out_tx_xattr_del(tsi->tsi_env, obj, name, &tti->tti_tea,
00409                               tti->tti_tea.ta_handle,
00410                               tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00411                               tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index);
00412         RETURN(rc);
00413 }

00418 static int out_ref_add(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00419 {
00420         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00421         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00422         int                      rc;
00423 
00424         ENTRY;
00425 
00426         rc = out_tx_ref_add(tsi->tsi_env, obj, &tti->tti_tea,
00427                             tti->tti_tea.ta_handle,
00428                             tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00429                             tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index);
00430         RETURN(rc);
00431 }
00432 
00433 static int out_ref_del(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00434 {
00435         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00436         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00437         int                      rc;
00438 
00439         ENTRY;
00440 
00441         if (!lu_object_exists(&obj->do_lu))
00442                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00443 
00444         rc = out_tx_ref_del(tsi->tsi_env, obj, &tti->tti_tea,
00445                             tti->tti_tea.ta_handle,
00446                             tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00447                             tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index);
00448         RETURN(rc);
00449 }
00450 
00451 static int out_index_insert(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00452 {
00453         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti    = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00454         struct object_update    *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00455         struct dt_object        *obj    = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00456         struct dt_insert_rec    *rec    = &tti->tti_rec;
00457         struct lu_fid           *fid;
00458         char                    *name;
00459         __u32                   *ptype;
00460         int                      rc     = 0;
00461         size_t                   size;
00462         ENTRY;
00463 
00464         name = object_update_param_get(update, 0, NULL);
00465         if (IS_ERR(name)) {
00466                 CERROR("%s: empty name for index insert: rc = %ld\n",
00467                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(name));
00468                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(name));
00469         }
00470 
00471         fid = object_update_param_get(update, 1, &size);
00472         if (IS_ERR(fid) || size != sizeof(*fid)) {
00473                 CERROR("%s: invalid fid: rc = %ld\n",
00474                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(fid));
00475                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(fid));
00476         }
00477 
00478         if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(tsi->tsi_pill->rc_req))
00479                 lustre_swab_lu_fid(fid);
00480 
00481         if (!fid_is_sane(fid)) {
00482                 CERROR("%s: invalid FID "DFID": rc = %d\n",
00483                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PFID(fid), -EPROTO);
00484                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00485         }
00486 
00487         ptype = object_update_param_get(update, 2, &size);
00488         if (IS_ERR(ptype) || size != sizeof(*ptype)) {
00489                 CERROR("%s: invalid type for index insert: rc = %ld\n",
00490                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(ptype));
00491                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(ptype));
00492         }
00493 
00494         if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(tsi->tsi_pill->rc_req))
00495                 __swab32s(ptype);
00496 
00497         rec->rec_fid = fid;
00498         rec->rec_type = *ptype;
00499 
00500         rc = out_tx_index_insert(tsi->tsi_env, obj, (const struct dt_rec *)rec,
00501                                  (const struct dt_key *)name, &tti->tti_tea,
00502                                  tti->tti_tea.ta_handle,
00503                                  tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00504                                  tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index);
00505         RETURN(rc);
00506 }
00507 
00508 static int out_index_delete(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00509 {
00510         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00511         struct object_update    *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00512         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00513         char                    *name;
00514         int                      rc = 0;
00515 
00516         if (!lu_object_exists(&obj->do_lu))
00517                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00518 
00519         name = object_update_param_get(update, 0, NULL);
00520         if (IS_ERR(name)) {
00521                 CERROR("%s: empty name for index delete: rc = %ld\n",
00522                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(name));
00523                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(name));
00524         }
00525 
00526         rc = out_tx_index_delete(tsi->tsi_env, obj, (const struct dt_key *)name,
00527                                  &tti->tti_tea, tti->tti_tea.ta_handle,
00528                                  tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00529                                  tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index);
00530         RETURN(rc);
00531 }
00532 
00533 static int out_destroy(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00534 {
00535         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00536         struct object_update    *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00537         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00538         struct lu_fid           *fid;
00539         int                      rc;
00540         ENTRY;
00541 
00542         fid = &update->ou_fid;
00543         if (!fid_is_sane(fid)) {
00544                 CERROR("%s: invalid FID "DFID": rc = %d\n",
00545                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PFID(fid), -EPROTO);
00546                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00547         }
00548 
00549         if (!lu_object_exists(&obj->do_lu))
00550                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00551 
00552         rc = out_tx_destroy(tsi->tsi_env, obj, &tti->tti_tea,
00553                             tti->tti_tea.ta_handle,
00554                             tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00555                             tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index);
00556 
00557         RETURN(rc);
00558 }
00559 
00560 static int out_write(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00561 {
00562         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(tsi->tsi_env);
00563         struct object_update    *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00564         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00565         struct lu_buf           *lbuf = &tti->tti_buf;
00566         char                    *buf;
00567         __u64                   *tmp;
00568         size_t                  size = 0;
00569         size_t                  buf_len = 0;
00570         loff_t                  pos;
00571         int                      rc;
00572         ENTRY;
00573 
00574         buf = object_update_param_get(update, 0, &buf_len);
00575         if (IS_ERR(buf) || buf_len == 0) {
00576                 CERROR("%s: empty buf for xattr set: rc = %ld\n",
00577                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(buf));
00578                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(buf));
00579         }
00580         lbuf->lb_buf = buf;
00581         lbuf->lb_len = buf_len;
00582 
00583         tmp = object_update_param_get(update, 1, &size);
00584         if (IS_ERR(tmp) || size != sizeof(*tmp)) {
00585                 CERROR("%s: empty or wrong size %zu pos: rc = %ld\n",
00586                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), size, PTR_ERR(tmp));
00587                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(tmp));
00588         }
00589 
00590         if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(tsi->tsi_pill->rc_req))
00591                 __swab64s(tmp);
00592         pos = *tmp;
00593 
00594         rc = out_tx_write(tsi->tsi_env, obj, lbuf, pos,
00595                           &tti->tti_tea, tti->tti_tea.ta_handle,
00596                           tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply,
00597                           tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index);
00598         RETURN(rc);
00599 }
00600 
00601 static int out_read(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00602 {
00603         const struct lu_env     *env = tsi->tsi_env;
00604         struct tgt_thread_info  *tti = tgt_th_info(env);
00605         struct object_update    *update = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update;
00606         struct dt_object        *obj = tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object;
00607         struct object_update_reply *reply = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply;
00608         int index = tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index;
00609         struct lu_rdbuf *rdbuf;
00610         struct object_update_result *update_result;
00611         struct out_read_reply   *orr;
00612         void *tmp;
00613         size_t size;
00614         size_t total_size = 0;
00615         __u64 pos;
00616         unsigned int i;
00617         unsigned int nbufs;
00618         int rc = 0;
00619         ENTRY;
00620 
00621         update_result = object_update_result_get(reply, index, NULL);
00622         LASSERT(update_result != NULL);
00623         update_result->our_datalen = sizeof(*orr);
00624 
00625         if (!lu_object_exists(&obj->do_lu))
00626                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
00627 
00628         tmp = object_update_param_get(update, 0, NULL);
00629         if (IS_ERR(tmp)) {
00630                 CERROR("%s: empty size for read: rc = %ld\n",
00631                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(tmp));
00632                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(tmp));
00633         }
00634         size = le64_to_cpu(*(size_t *)(tmp));
00635 
00636         tmp = object_update_param_get(update, 1, NULL);
00637         if (IS_ERR(tmp)) {
00638                 CERROR("%s: empty pos for read: rc = %ld\n",
00639                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), PTR_ERR(tmp));
00640                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(tmp));
00641         }
00642         pos = le64_to_cpu(*(__u64 *)(tmp));
00643 
00644         /* Put the offset into the begining of the buffer in reply */
00645         orr = (struct out_read_reply *)update_result->our_data;
00646 
00647         nbufs = (size + OUT_BULK_BUFFER_SIZE - 1) / OUT_BULK_BUFFER_SIZE;
00648         OBD_ALLOC(rdbuf, sizeof(struct lu_rdbuf) +
00649                          nbufs * sizeof(rdbuf->rb_bufs[0]));
00650         if (rdbuf == NULL)
00651                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00652 
00653         rdbuf->rb_nbufs = 0;
00654         total_size = 0;
00655         for (i = 0; i < nbufs; i++) {
00656                 __u32 read_size;
00657 
00658                 read_size = size > OUT_BULK_BUFFER_SIZE ?
00659                             OUT_BULK_BUFFER_SIZE : size;
00660                 OBD_ALLOC(rdbuf->rb_bufs[i].lb_buf, read_size);
00661                 if (rdbuf->rb_bufs[i].lb_buf == NULL)
00662                         GOTO(out_free, rc = -ENOMEM);
00663 
00664                 rdbuf->rb_bufs[i].lb_len = read_size;
00665                 dt_read_lock(env, obj, MOR_TGT_CHILD);
00666                 rc = dt_read(env, obj, &rdbuf->rb_bufs[i], &pos);
00667                 dt_read_unlock(env, obj);
00668 
00669                 total_size += rc < 0 ? 0 : rc;
00670                 if (rc <= 0)
00671                         break;
00672 
00673                 rdbuf->rb_nbufs++;
00674                 size -= read_size;
00675         }
00676 
00677         /* send pages to client */
00678         rc = tgt_send_buffer(tsi, rdbuf);
00679         if (rc < 0)
00680                 GOTO(out_free, rc);
00681 
00682         orr->orr_size = total_size;
00683         orr->orr_offset = pos;
00684 
00685         orr_cpu_to_le(orr, orr);
00686         update_result->our_datalen += orr->orr_size;
00687 out_free:
00688         for (i = 0; i < nbufs; i++) {
00689                 if (rdbuf->rb_bufs[i].lb_buf != NULL) {
00690                         OBD_FREE(rdbuf->rb_bufs[i].lb_buf,
00691                                  rdbuf->rb_bufs[i].lb_len);
00692                 }
00693         }
00694         OBD_FREE(rdbuf, sizeof(struct lu_rdbuf) +
00695                         nbufs * sizeof(rdbuf->rb_bufs[0]));
00696 out:
00697         /* Insert read buffer */
00698         update_result->our_rc = ptlrpc_status_hton(rc);
00699         reply->ourp_lens[index] = cfs_size_round(update_result->our_datalen +
00700                                                  sizeof(*update_result));
00701         RETURN(rc);
00702 }
00703 
00704 static int out_noop(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00705 {
00706         return 0;
00707 }
00708 
00709 #define DEF_OUT_HNDL(opc, name, flags, fn)     \
00710 [opc - OUT_CREATE] = {                                  \
00711         .th_name    = name,                             \
00712         .th_fail_id = 0,                                \
00713         .th_opc     = opc,                              \
00714         .th_flags   = flags,                            \
00715         .th_act     = fn,                               \
00716         .th_fmt     = NULL,                             \
00717         .th_version = 0,                                \
00718 }
00719 
00720 static struct tgt_handler out_update_ops[] = {
00721         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_CREATE, "out_create", MUTABOR | HABEO_REFERO,
00722                      out_create),
00723         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_DESTROY, "out_create", MUTABOR | HABEO_REFERO,
00724                      out_destroy),
00725         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_REF_ADD, "out_ref_add", MUTABOR | HABEO_REFERO,
00726                      out_ref_add),
00727         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_REF_DEL, "out_ref_del", MUTABOR | HABEO_REFERO,
00728                      out_ref_del),
00729         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_ATTR_SET, "out_attr_set",  MUTABOR | HABEO_REFERO,
00730                      out_attr_set),
00731         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_ATTR_GET, "out_attr_get",  HABEO_REFERO,
00732                      out_attr_get),
00733         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_XATTR_SET, "out_xattr_set", MUTABOR | HABEO_REFERO,
00734                      out_xattr_set),
00735         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_XATTR_DEL, "out_xattr_del", MUTABOR | HABEO_REFERO,
00736                      out_xattr_del),
00737         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_XATTR_GET, "out_xattr_get", HABEO_REFERO,
00738                      out_xattr_get),
00739         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_INDEX_LOOKUP, "out_index_lookup", HABEO_REFERO,
00740                      out_index_lookup),
00741         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_INDEX_INSERT, "out_index_insert",
00742                      MUTABOR | HABEO_REFERO, out_index_insert),
00743         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_INDEX_DELETE, "out_index_delete",
00744                      MUTABOR | HABEO_REFERO, out_index_delete),
00745         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_WRITE, "out_write", MUTABOR | HABEO_REFERO, out_write),
00746         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_READ, "out_read", HABEO_REFERO, out_read),
00747         DEF_OUT_HNDL(OUT_NOOP, "out_noop", HABEO_REFERO, out_noop),
00748 };
00749 
00750 static struct tgt_handler *out_handler_find(__u32 opc)
00751 {
00752         struct tgt_handler *h;
00753 
00754         h = NULL;
00755         if (OUT_CREATE <= opc && opc < OUT_LAST) {
00756                 h = &out_update_ops[opc - OUT_CREATE];
00757                 LASSERTF(h->th_opc == opc, "opcode mismatch %d != %d\n",
00758                          h->th_opc, opc);
00759         } else {
00760                 h = NULL; /* unsupported opc */
00761         }
00762         return h;
00763 }
00764 
00765 static int out_tx_start(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *dt,
00766                         struct thandle_exec_args *ta, struct obd_export *exp)
00767 {
00768         ta->ta_argno = 0;
00769         ta->ta_handle = dt_trans_create(env, dt);
00770         if (IS_ERR(ta->ta_handle)) {
00771                 int rc;
00772 
00773                 rc = PTR_ERR(ta->ta_handle);
00774                 ta->ta_handle = NULL;
00775                 CERROR("%s: start handle error: rc = %d\n", dt_obd_name(dt),
00776                        rc);
00777                 return rc;
00778         }
00779         if (exp->exp_need_sync)
00780                 ta->ta_handle->th_sync = 1;
00781 
00782         return 0;
00783 }
00784 
00785 static int out_trans_start(const struct lu_env *env,
00786                            struct thandle_exec_args *ta)
00787 {
00788         return dt_trans_start(env, ta->ta_handle->th_dev, ta->ta_handle);
00789 }
00790 
00791 static int out_trans_stop(const struct lu_env *env,
00792                           struct thandle_exec_args *ta, int err)
00793 {
00794         int i;
00795         int rc;
00796 
00797         ta->ta_handle->th_result = err;
00798         rc = dt_trans_stop(env, ta->ta_handle->th_dev, ta->ta_handle);
00799         for (i = 0; i < ta->ta_argno; i++) {
00800                 if (ta->ta_args[i]->object != NULL) {
00801                         struct dt_object *obj = ta->ta_args[i]->object;
00802 
00803                         /* If the object is being created during this
00804                          * transaction, we need to remove them from the
00805                          * cache immediately, because a few layers are
00806                          * missing in OUT handler, i.e. the object might
00807                          * not be initialized in all layers */
00808                         if (ta->ta_args[i]->exec_fn == out_tx_create_exec)
00809                                 set_bit(LU_OBJECT_HEARD_BANSHEE,
00810                                         &obj->do_lu.lo_header->loh_flags);
00811                         lu_object_put(env, &ta->ta_args[i]->object->do_lu);
00812                         ta->ta_args[i]->object = NULL;
00813                 }
00814         }
00815         ta->ta_handle = NULL;
00816         ta->ta_argno = 0;
00817 
00818         return rc;
00819 }
00820 
00821 static int out_tx_end(const struct lu_env *env, struct thandle_exec_args *ta,
00822                       int declare_ret)
00823 {
00824         struct tgt_session_info *tsi = tgt_ses_info(env);
00825         int                     i;
00826         int                     rc;
00827         int                     rc1;
00828         ENTRY;
00829 
00830         if (ta->ta_handle == NULL)
00831                 RETURN(0);
00832 
00833         if (declare_ret != 0 || ta->ta_argno == 0)
00834                 GOTO(stop, rc = declare_ret);
00835 
00836         LASSERT(ta->ta_handle->th_dev != NULL);
00837         rc = out_trans_start(env, ta);
00838         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
00839                 GOTO(stop, rc);
00840 
00841         for (i = 0; i < ta->ta_argno; i++) {
00842                 rc = ta->ta_args[i]->exec_fn(env, ta->ta_handle,
00843                                              ta->ta_args[i]);
00844                 if (unlikely(rc != 0)) {
00845                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "error during execution of #%u from"
00846                                " %s:%d: rc = %d\n", i, ta->ta_args[i]->file,
00847                                ta->ta_args[i]->line, rc);
00848                         while (--i >= 0) {
00849                                 if (ta->ta_args[i]->undo_fn != NULL)
00850                                         ta->ta_args[i]->undo_fn(env,
00851                                                                ta->ta_handle,
00852                                                                ta->ta_args[i]);
00853                                 else
00854                                         CERROR("%s: undo for %s:%d: rc = %d\n",
00855                                              dt_obd_name(ta->ta_handle->th_dev),
00856                                                ta->ta_args[i]->file,
00857                                                ta->ta_args[i]->line, -ENOTSUPP);
00858                         }
00859                         break;
00860                 }
00861                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: executed %u/%u: rc = %d\n",
00862                        dt_obd_name(ta->ta_handle->th_dev), i, ta->ta_argno, rc);
00863         }
00864 
00865         /* Only fail for real updates, XXX right now llog updates will be
00866         * ignore, whose updates count is usually 1, so failover test
00867         * case will spot this FAIL_UPDATE_NET_REP precisely, and it will
00868         * be removed after async update patch is landed. */
00869         if (ta->ta_argno > 1)
00870                 tsi->tsi_reply_fail_id = OBD_FAIL_OUT_UPDATE_NET_REP;
00871 
00872 stop:
00873         rc1 = out_trans_stop(env, ta, rc);
00874         if (rc == 0)
00875                 rc = rc1;
00876 
00877         ta->ta_handle = NULL;
00878         ta->ta_argno = 0;
00879 
00880         RETURN(rc);
00881 }
00882 
00894 int out_handle(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00895 {
00896         const struct lu_env             *env = tsi->tsi_env;
00897         struct tgt_thread_info          *tti = tgt_th_info(env);
00898         struct thandle_exec_args        *ta = &tti->tti_tea;
00899         struct req_capsule              *pill = tsi->tsi_pill;
00900         struct dt_device                *dt = tsi->tsi_tgt->lut_bottom;
00901         struct out_update_header        *ouh;
00902         struct out_update_buffer        *oub = NULL;
00903         struct object_update            *update;
00904         struct object_update_reply      *reply;
00905         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc         *desc = NULL;
00906         struct l_wait_info              lwi;
00907         void                            **update_bufs;
00908         int                             current_batchid = -1;
00909         __u32                           update_buf_count;
00910         unsigned int                    i;
00911         unsigned int                    reply_index = 0;
00912         int                             rc = 0;
00913         int                             rc1 = 0;
00914         int                             ouh_size, reply_size;
00915         int                             updates;
00916         ENTRY;
00917 
00918         req_capsule_set(pill, &RQF_OUT_UPDATE);
00919         ouh_size = req_capsule_get_size(pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_HEADER,
00920                                         RCL_CLIENT);
00921         if (ouh_size <= 0)
00922                 RETURN(err_serious(-EPROTO));
00923 
00924         ouh = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_HEADER);
00925         if (ouh == NULL)
00926                 RETURN(err_serious(-EPROTO));
00927 
00928         if (ouh->ouh_magic != OUT_UPDATE_HEADER_MAGIC) {
00929                 CERROR("%s: invalid update buffer magic %x expect %x: "
00930                        "rc = %d\n", tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), ouh->ouh_magic,
00931                        UPDATE_REQUEST_MAGIC, -EPROTO);
00932                 RETURN(err_serious(-EPROTO));
00933         }
00934 
00935         update_buf_count = ouh->ouh_count;
00936         if (update_buf_count == 0)
00937                 RETURN(err_serious(-EPROTO));
00938 
00939         OBD_ALLOC(update_bufs, sizeof(*update_bufs) * update_buf_count);
00940         if (update_bufs == NULL)
00941                 RETURN(err_serious(-ENOMEM));
00942 
00943         if (ouh->ouh_inline_length > 0) {
00944                 update_bufs[0] = ouh->ouh_inline_data;
00945         } else {
00946                 struct out_update_buffer *tmp;
00947 
00948                 oub = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_BUF);
00949                 if (oub == NULL)
00950                         GOTO(out_free, rc = err_serious(-EPROTO));
00951 
00952                 desc = ptlrpc_prep_bulk_exp(pill->rc_req, update_buf_count,
00953                                             PTLRPC_BULK_OPS_COUNT,
00954                                             PTLRPC_BULK_GET_SINK |
00955                                             PTLRPC_BULK_BUF_KVEC,
00956                                             MDS_BULK_PORTAL,
00957                                             &ptlrpc_bulk_kvec_ops);
00958                 if (desc == NULL)
00959                         GOTO(out_free, rc = err_serious(-ENOMEM));
00960 
00961                 tmp = oub;
00962                 for (i = 0; i < update_buf_count; i++, tmp++) {
00963                         if (tmp->oub_size >= OUT_MAXREQSIZE)
00964                                 GOTO(out_free, rc = err_serious(-EPROTO));
00965 
00966                         OBD_ALLOC(update_bufs[i], tmp->oub_size);
00967                         if (update_bufs[i] == NULL)
00968                                 GOTO(out_free, rc = err_serious(-ENOMEM));
00969 
00970                         desc->bd_frag_ops->add_iov_frag(desc, update_bufs[i],
00971                                                         tmp->oub_size);
00972                 }
00973 
00974                 pill->rc_req->rq_bulk_write = 1;
00975                 rc = sptlrpc_svc_prep_bulk(pill->rc_req, desc);
00976                 if (rc != 0)
00977                         GOTO(out_free, rc = err_serious(rc));
00978 
00979                 rc = target_bulk_io(pill->rc_req->rq_export, desc, &lwi);
00980                 if (rc < 0)
00981                         GOTO(out_free, rc = err_serious(rc));
00982         }
00983         /* validate the request and calculate the total update count and
00984          * set it to reply */
00985         reply_size = 0;
00986         updates = 0;
00987         for (i = 0; i < update_buf_count; i++) {
00988                 struct object_update_request    *our;
00989                 int                              j;
00990 
00991                 our = update_bufs[i];
00992                 if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(pill->rc_req))
00993                         lustre_swab_object_update_request(our);
00994 
00995                 if (our->ourq_magic != UPDATE_REQUEST_MAGIC) {
00996                         CERROR("%s: invalid update buffer magic %x"
00997                                " expect %x: rc = %d\n",
00998                                tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), our->ourq_magic,
00999                                UPDATE_REQUEST_MAGIC, -EPROTO);
01000                         GOTO(out_free, rc = err_serious(-EPROTO));
01001                 }
01002                 updates += our->ourq_count;
01003 
01004                 /* need to calculate reply size */
01005                 for (j = 0; j < our->ourq_count; j++) {
01006                         update = object_update_request_get(our, j, NULL);
01007                         if (update == NULL)
01008                                 GOTO(out, rc = err_serious(-EPROTO));
01009                         if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(pill->rc_req))
01010                                 lustre_swab_object_update(update);
01011 
01012                         if (!fid_is_sane(&update->ou_fid)) {
01013                                 CERROR("%s: invalid FID "DFID": rc = %d\n",
01014                                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt),
01015                                        PFID(&update->ou_fid), -EPROTO);
01016                                 GOTO(out, rc = err_serious(-EPROTO));
01017                         }
01018 
01019                         /* XXX: what ou_result_size can be considered safe? */
01020 
01021                         reply_size += sizeof(reply->ourp_lens[0]);
01022                         reply_size += sizeof(struct object_update_result);
01023                         reply_size += update->ou_result_size;
01024                 }
01025         }
01026         reply_size += sizeof(*reply);
01027 
01028         if (unlikely(reply_size > ouh->ouh_reply_size)) {
01029                 CERROR("%s: too small reply buf %u for %u, need %u at least\n",
01030                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), ouh->ouh_reply_size,
01031                        updates, reply_size);
01032                 GOTO(out_free, rc = err_serious(-EPROTO));
01033         }
01034 
01035         req_capsule_set_size(pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_REPLY, RCL_SERVER,
01036                              ouh->ouh_reply_size);
01037         rc = req_capsule_server_pack(pill);
01038         if (rc != 0) {
01039                 CERROR("%s: Can't pack response: rc = %d\n",
01040                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), rc);
01041                 GOTO(out_free, rc = err_serious(-EPROTO));
01042         }
01043 
01044         /* Prepare the update reply buffer */
01045         reply = req_capsule_server_get(pill, &RMF_OUT_UPDATE_REPLY);
01046         if (reply == NULL)
01047                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -EPROTO);
01048         reply->ourp_magic = UPDATE_REPLY_MAGIC;
01049         reply->ourp_count = updates;
01050         tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply = reply;
01051         tti->tti_mult_trans = !req_is_replay(tgt_ses_req(tsi));
01052  
01053         /* Walk through updates in the request to execute them */
01054         for (i = 0; i < update_buf_count; i++) {
01055                 struct tgt_handler      *h;
01056                 struct dt_object        *dt_obj;
01057                 int                     update_count;
01058                 struct object_update_request *our;
01059                 int                     j;
01060 
01061                 our = update_bufs[i];
01062                 update_count = our->ourq_count;
01063                 for (j = 0; j < update_count; j++) {
01064                         update = object_update_request_get(our, j, NULL);
01065 
01066                         dt_obj = dt_locate(env, dt, &update->ou_fid);
01067                         if (IS_ERR(dt_obj))
01068                                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(dt_obj));
01069 
01070                         if (dt->dd_record_fid_accessed) {
01071                                 lfsck_pack_rfa(&tti->tti_lr,
01072                                                lu_object_fid(&dt_obj->do_lu),
01073                                                LE_FID_ACCESSED,
01074                                                LFSCK_TYPE_LAYOUT);
01075                                 tgt_lfsck_in_notify(env, dt, &tti->tti_lr,
01076                                                     NULL);
01077                         }
01078 
01079                         tti->tti_u.update.tti_dt_object = dt_obj;
01080                         tti->tti_u.update.tti_update = update;
01081                         tti->tti_u.update.tti_update_reply_index = reply_index;
01082 
01083                         h = out_handler_find(update->ou_type);
01084                         if (unlikely(h == NULL)) {
01085                                 CERROR("%s: unsupported opc: 0x%x\n",
01086                                        tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt), update->ou_type);
01087                                 GOTO(next, rc = -ENOTSUPP);
01088                         }
01089 
01090                         /* Check resend case only for modifying RPC */
01091                         if (h->th_flags & MUTABOR) {
01092                                 struct ptlrpc_request *req = tgt_ses_req(tsi);
01093 
01094                                 if (out_check_resent(env, dt, dt_obj, req,
01095                                                      out_reconstruct, reply,
01096                                                      reply_index))
01097                                         GOTO(next, rc = 0);
01098                         }
01099 
01100                         /* start transaction for modification RPC only */
01101                         if (h->th_flags & MUTABOR && current_batchid == -1) {
01102                                 current_batchid = update->ou_batchid;
01103                                 rc = out_tx_start(env, dt, ta, tsi->tsi_exp);
01104                                 if (rc != 0)
01105                                         GOTO(next, rc);
01106 
01107                                 if (update->ou_flags & UPDATE_FL_SYNC)
01108                                         ta->ta_handle->th_sync = 1;
01109                         }
01110 
01111                         /* Stop the current update transaction, if the update
01112                          * has different batchid, or read-only update */
01113                         if (((current_batchid != update->ou_batchid) ||
01114                              !(h->th_flags & MUTABOR)) &&
01115                              ta->ta_handle != NULL) {
01116                                 rc = out_tx_end(env, ta, rc);
01117                                 current_batchid = -1;
01118                                 if (rc != 0)
01119                                         GOTO(next, rc);
01120 
01121                                 /* start a new transaction if needed */
01122                                 if (h->th_flags & MUTABOR) {
01123                                         rc = out_tx_start(env, dt, ta,
01124                                                           tsi->tsi_exp);
01125                                         if (rc != 0)
01126                                                 GOTO(next, rc);
01127                                         if (update->ou_flags & UPDATE_FL_SYNC)
01128                                                 ta->ta_handle->th_sync = 1;
01129                                         current_batchid = update->ou_batchid;
01130                                 }
01131                         }
01132 
01133                         rc = h->th_act(tsi);
01134 next:
01135                         reply_index++;
01136                         lu_object_put(env, &dt_obj->do_lu);
01137                         if (rc < 0)
01138                                 GOTO(out, rc);
01139                 }
01140         }
01141 out:
01142         if (current_batchid != -1) {
01143                 rc1 = out_tx_end(env, ta, rc);
01144                 if (rc == 0)
01145                         rc = rc1;
01146         }
01147 
01148 out_free:
01149         if (update_bufs != NULL) {
01150                 if (oub != NULL) {
01151                         for (i = 0; i < update_buf_count; i++, oub++) {
01152                                 if (update_bufs[i] != NULL)
01153                                         OBD_FREE(update_bufs[i], oub->oub_size);
01154                         }
01155                 }
01156 
01157                 OBD_FREE(update_bufs, sizeof(*update_bufs) * update_buf_count);
01158         }
01159 
01160         if (desc != NULL)
01161                 ptlrpc_free_bulk(desc);
01162 
01163         RETURN(rc);
01164 }
01165 
01166 struct tgt_handler tgt_out_handlers[] = {
01167 TGT_UPDATE_HDL(MUTABOR, OUT_UPDATE,     out_handle),
01168 };
01169 EXPORT_SYMBOL(tgt_out_handlers);
01170
